content:
• Monday, December 31, 2018
  • HASI

    HASI, VIPS, HTY and IMH among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: HASI +6.82%. VIPS +4.76%. WTI +4.37%. P +2.66%. TRXC +2.65%.
    • Top Losers: HTY -8.13%. IMH -7.41%. TEF -5.44%. MFGP -5.17%. SKY -5.11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 7 Comments
  • PTI

    Proteostasis up 8% after hours on successful Phase 1 study of PTI-428

    • Proteostasis Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTI) is up 8% after hours on the heels of its Phase 1 clinical trial evaluating PTI-428 in cystic fibrosis patients on background Kalydeco (ivacaftor) therapy.
    • The company says the study met the primary (safety and tolerability) and secondary endpoints (pharmacokinetics) but it did not perform exploratory analyses on other measures (efficacy) due to the small number of enrollees.
    • Related ticker: (NASDAQ:VRTX)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 11 Comments
  • CHFS

    CHF Solutions files for equity offering

    • CHF Solutions (NASDAQ:CHFS) has filed a preliminary prospectus for a public offering of Class A and Class B Units.
    • Each Class A Unit will consist of one common share and one warrant to purchase one common share.
    • Each Class B Unit will consist of one share of Series G Convertible Preferred Stock valued at $1,000 and warrants to purchase the same number of converted common shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • NVAX

    Novavax files for $100M stock offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX) slips 4% after hours in response to its planned sale of up to $100M of its common stock through sales agent B. Riley FBR who will earn a 2% commission for its efforts.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 54 Comments
  • ADMP

    Adamis Pharma submits U.S. marketing application for naloxone prefilled syringe; shares up 1% after hours

    • Adamis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADMP) is up 1% after hours following its announcement that it has filed a U.S. marketing application seeking approval for a single-dose prefilled syringe formulation of opioid overdose agent naloxone.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 6 Comments
  • CMXC

    Cell MedX secures $250K credit linek; shares down 27%

    • Ultra-thinly traded Cell MedX Corp. (OTCQB:CMXC -26.7%) is down, albeit on turnover of only 1,000 shares, on the heels of its announcement that it has established an unsecured $250K line of credit with top shareholder Richard Jeffs. $100K was advanced to the company on December 20.
    • Borrowings will carry a 6% interest rate. Mr. Jeffs has received three-year warrants to purchase up to 5M common shares at $0.05 per share contingent on the total borrowed (he received warrants to purchase 2M common shares based on the $100K advancement).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • HLTH

    Nobilis Health lands new in-network contract; shares up 44%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Nobilis Health (HLTH +44%) is up on more than double normal volume on the heels of its announcement that it has inked an in-network contract with Plano Surgical Hospital that will commence tomorrow, January 1, 2019.
    • The facility is now in-network with three of the largest commercial payors in the U.S.
    • The company says the contract increases its in-network status in Texas to ~60%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 6 Comments
  • APHA

    Green Growth re-emphasizes intent to acquire Aphria

    • Green Growth Brands reaffirms its commitment to acquire pot producer Aphria (APHA -6.5%) for C$11 per share. If consummated, Aphria shareholders will own 60% of the combined company while Green Growth shareholders will own ~34%. Subscribers to its C$300M financing will own ~6%.
    • Aphria's board has been cool to the unsolicited offer, however. Green Growth is undeterred, willing to work with Aphria to "find ways" to enhance value for both companies, adding that it is confident that it can secure the C$300M financing that appears contingent on a C$7/share valuation.
    • Green Growth says over 10% of Aphria's shareholders have indicated their support for the transaction.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 78 Comments
  • CMCSA

    Comcast settles FCC dispute

    • Comcast's (NASDAQ:CMCSA) NBC/Telemundo will pay $495K to settle with the FCC on alleged violations of the Children's Television Act of 1990.
    • The consent decree relates to some stations preempting required children's programing with sports.
    • Comcast shares are down 1.6% to $33.62.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • SLF

    Sun Life raised to buy by Argus

    • Sun Life Financial (NYSE:SLF) gains 1.9% after Argus analyst Steve Delaney upgrades the stock to buy from hold, saying the stock's valuation is more attractive after it fell 18% since his last report.
    • Notes consistent, strong earnings; above peer average ROE; some small acquisitions should bolster earnings.
    • Price target: $39.
    • Source: The Fly.
    • Analyst ratings: 8 buys; 7 holds; 0 underperform/sell.
    • Previously: Sun Life Financial to acquire majority stake in Bentall GreenOak (Dec. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 4 Comments
  • PTLA

    Trading halt on Portola Pharmaceuticals

    • Portola Pharmaceuticals (PTLA -3.2%) is under a Nasdaq trading halt with news pending out from the company.
    • Bloomberg reports that an Andexxa-related decision is due out from the FDA today.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 19 Comments
  • LEU

    Centrus Energy and Bristow Group among Energy/Materials gainers; American Midstream Partners and ION Geophysical among losers

    • Gainers: Centrus Energy (NYSEMKT:LEU) +13%. Bristow Group (NYSE:BRS) +12%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +12%. Ossen Innovation (NASDAQ:OSN) +10%. SilverCrest Metals (NYSEMKT:SILV) +9%.
    • Losers: American Midstream Partners (NYSE:AMID) -27%. ION Geophysical (NYSE:IO) -9%. Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) -9%. Pioneer Energy Services (NYSE:PES) -9%. Piedmont Lithium (NASDAQ:PLL) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • F

    Headwinds seen for Detroit Three in 2019

    • The auto industry has had a rough ride in 2018 and the focus on the last trading day has been on numbers coming out later this week on December U.S. sales.
    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch expects total U.S. auto sales to fall off 1% in December. Ford's (F -1.7%) sales are forecast to drop 7.5% during the month, while Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCAU -0.5%) is seen churning up a 15% gain for the month on a strong performance for the Jeep Compass, Jeep Wrangler and Jeep Cherokee models. General Motors (GM -1.1%) is anticipated to post a flat Y/Y sales month as the automaker sticks with a disciplined approach to pricing.
    • All three Detroit automakers are down sharply for the year, led by Ford's 39% tumble, and the view for 2019 isn't particularly rosy either.
    • BAML's outlook for 2019: "We believe there were a variety of factors that won't repeat and propped up sales, such as replacement demand from natural disasters in 2H:17 and tax reform. As such, we continue to believe that the US cycle has entered the early innings of a downturn. Furthermore, a number of headwinds are increasingly intensifying, including price/mix, raw materials, and interest rates, which could drive further sales declines into next year."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 82 Comments
  • KFS

    CNAT, AMID, PIRS and APVO among notable midday movers

    • Gainers: KFS +27%. CNAT +23%. VTVT +22%. CADC +20%. IPIC +20%. AXSM +18%. LPCN +19%. MGEN +17%. SHOS +17%. EQ +17%.
    • Losers: NFEC -29%. AMID -28%. APVO -14%. ESTR -14%. NDRA -13%. CARV -13%. PIRS -13%. ANY -13%. ASTC -12%. PLXP -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • KFS

    Kingsway Financial Services leads financial gainers; Elbit Imaging and Camping World Holdings among losers

    • Gainers: Kingsway Financial Services (NYSE:KFS) +23%. Landmark Infrastructure Partners (NASDAQ:LMRK) +11%. Conifer Holdings (NASDAQ:CNFR) +7%. Broadway Financial (NASDAQ:BYFC) +6%. X Financial (NYSE:XYF) +5%.
    • Losers: Carver Bancorp (NASDAQ:CARV) -13%. Elbit Imaging (NASDAQ:EMITF) -11%. Camping World Holdings (NYSE:CWH) -8%. China Rapid Finance (NYSE:XRF) -8%. Equus Total Return (NYSE:EQS) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • ARLZQ

    Aralez Pharma completes sale of Vimovo royalties and Canadian ops; shares up 50%

    • Aralez Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:ARLZQ +50%) has completed the sale of its VIMOVO royalties and Canadian operations to Nuvo Pharmaceuticals for $110M.
    • The sale of its TOPROL-XL franchise to Deerfield Management for $130M remains in process.
    • Aralez filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in August 2018.
    • Previously: Nuvo Pharmaceuticals to acquire commercial products and infrastructure from Aralez Pharmaceuticals (Sept. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • CWH

    Camping World sell-off extends

    • Investors continue to bid down Camping World (CWH -8.1%) after the company disclosed the exit of President Roger Nuttall late on Friday.
    • Volume on CWH has already topped the normal daily average of 1.07M shares.
    • Shares of Camping World are now down 42% over the last 90 days, despite signs during December of some inventory stabilization in the RV industry.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 23 Comments
  • FUV

    Arcimoto leads consumer gainers; Energous and B&G Food among losers

    • Gainers: Arcimoto (NASDAQ:FUV) +13%. Kewaunee Scientific (NASDAQ:KEQU) +10%. Xcel Brands (NASDAQ:XELB) +8%. Youngevity International (NASDAQ:YGYI) +5%.
    • Losers: Pingtan Marine Enterprise (NASDAQ:PME) -12%. Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) -10%. B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS) -6%. P. H. Glatfelter (NYSE:GLT) -6%. DAVIDsTEA (NASDAQ:DTEA) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • ICPT

    CNBC article highlights $35B market opportunity of NASH drugs

    • CNBC reports that nonalcoholic steatohepatitis or NASH is "next big thing" for drug makers, a potential market of $35B or more if pharma/biotech firms can successfully navigate the regulatory process, a task none has accomplished to date.
    • NASH, an obesity-related complication, is believed to affect about 30M Americans. Its precursor, nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, affects ~89M Americans, including people in their 20s and 30s.
    • The FDA has approved only one NASH candidate thus far, Intercept Pharmaceuticals' (ICPT +4.5%) Ocaliva (obeticholic acid), for a rare autoimmune disorder called primary biliary cholangitis (PBC) that can lead to cirrhosis. The agency OK'd the drug in May 2016.
    • Several companies have potential therapies in Phase 3 development. Most candidates are in Phase 2.
    • NASH-related tickers: (MDGL +3.5%)(VKTX +0.5%)(GILD +0.5%)(CBAY -0.5%)(ENTA -1.1%)(RGLS -0.9%)(INNT -4.9%)(CNAT +18.8%)(WVE +2.1%)(IONS +4.1%)(OTCPK:GNFTF +1.2%)(REGN +2.7%)(ALNY +4.5%)(ASMB +0.4%)(CANF +1.9%)(DRRX -1.8%)(GLMD -4.5%)(IMRN)(GEMP +4.1%)(ORMP -1.9%)(AGN -0.3%)(VBLT +3.9%)(SHPG +0.6%)(DRNA +2.3%)(HZNP -0.1%)(ARCT +10.9%)(RETA +1.1%)(FGEN +1.6%)(PFE +0.9%)(NVS +0.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 60 Comments
  • NKE

    Digging through the retail stocks bin

    • Analysts continue to find some value picks after the sell-off across the retail sector. The latest is Piper Jaffray retail analyst Erinn Murphy, who singles out lifestyle brand companies as her top retail sector picks for 2019.
    • Murphy's list of favorites from the retail bin includes Nike (NKE +0.3%), Under Armour (UA, UAA), Ulta Beauty (ULTA +1.3%), Crocs (CROX -2%) and Funko (FNKO -2.4%).
    • On a broader look at the sector, various reads on retail sales have come in strong over the last few weeks, but investors have been slow to shake off trade jitters and concerns of an economic slowdown for major names such as Target (TGT +1.2%), Walmart (WMT +0.5%) and Costco (COST -0.1%).
    • Retail stocks trading with a single digit forward price-to-earnings ratio include Michaels Companies (MIK -0.1%), Party City (PRTY +0.2%), J. Jill (JILL +1.9%), Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY -3.4%), Macy's (M -0.9%) and L Brands (LB -0.5%).
    • ETFs: XLY, XRT, VCR, RTH, RETL, FDIS, IYK, FXD, IYC, EMTY, SCC, RCD, UCC, PMR, UGE, SZK, FTXD, JHMC
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 20 Comments
  • HLTH

    Nobilis adds to rally, up 26%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Nobilis Health (HLTH +25.8%) is up on below-average volume. Shares have more than doubled since last Wednesday.
    • On Thursday, December 27, the company announced the appointment of new CEO James Springfield. The company will host a conference call on Wednesday, January 2, 2019, at 8:00 am ET to introduce him to investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • VTVT

    Conatus Pharmaceuticals and Axsome Therapeutics among healthcare gainers; Aphria and Aptevo Therapeutics among losers

    • Gainers: vTv Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VTVT) +35%. Conatus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CNAT) +18%. Axsome Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AXSM) +17%. Miragen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MGEN) +15%. Marker Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MRKR) +15%.
    • Losers: Aptevo Therapeutics (NASDAQ:APVO) -11%. OptiNose (NASDAQ:OPTN) -11%. ENDRA Life Sciences (NASDAQ:NDRA) -11%. BioLife Solutions (NASDAQ:BLFS) -9%. Aphria (NYSE:APHA) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • TSLA

    Tesla still with plenty of inventory?

    • According to Elektrek, Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) still has more than 3K Model 3s in U.S. inventory as of Sunday.
    • That would be at odds with the company's aim to liquidate all inventory by year-end. While some cars will surely be delivered today, more than 3K seems unlikely.
    • Shares have reversed an early gain, now down 0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 200 Comments
  • SQ

    Fintech ETFs outperform the S&P in 2018

    • Though hardly a stellar performance, global X FinTech Thematic ETF (NASDAQ:FINX) edged up 0.5% during the year and ETFMG Prime Mobile Payments ETF (NYSEARCA:IPAY) -0.1% in the past year, both outperforming the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (NYSEARCA:SPY), which fell 5.4% in the past year.
    • The two fintech ETFs look even better when compared with the financial sector overall. The Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (NYSEARCA:XLF) fell 14% in the past year.
    • Among individual fintech names, Square (NYSE:SQ) stood out as the most impressive gainer, surging 61% during the year. Others that climbed during the year--Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) +24%, PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) +13%, Fiserv (NASDAQ:FISV) +11%.
    • The big difference between FINX and IPAY is that IPAY holds big credit card companies--American Express (NYSE:AXP), Mastercard (NYSE:MA), Visa (NYSE:V), and Discover Financial (NYSE:DFS), some of which weighed down the ETF.
    • DFS fell 24% during the year and AXP slid 4.9%, while MA rose 23% and V increased 15%.
    • Meanwhile, FINX focuses more on the tech part of fintech, including Intuit, SS&C Technologies (NASDAQ:SSNC) +11%, and Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) +6.9%.
    • Previously: Payment stocks with `recession resistance' may outperform in 2019: RBC (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 12 Comments
  • NNDM

    Nano Dimension up 24%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Nano Dimension Ltd. (NNDM +23.5%) is up on almost triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 241K shares.
    • Earlier this month, the additive electronics provider filed a prospectus supplement for a $25M equity offering.
    • Last week it announced DragonFly Pro reseller deals in Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxemburg and Israel.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 7 Comments
  • FUV

    Arcimoto adds to capital raise-stoked up move, shares ahead 17%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Arcimoto (FUV +16.6%) is up on average volume, adding to Friday's 19% move in response to its $4.5M capital raise.
    • Specifically, the company sold 500K shares of common stock at $3 per share and issued a $3M one-year secured senior note bearing 10% interest plus a warrant to purchase ~943K common shares at $3.50 per share.
    • Net proceeds will fund the manufacture, assembly and delivery of its first retail Fun Utility Vehicles.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • EROS

    Eros announces syndication deals

    • Eros (NYSE:EROS) announces executing several long-term television syndication deals with TV networks around the world for its over 60 catalogue films.
    • The TV networks include Viacom – Colors in India, SABC in South Africa, E Vision in the UAE, and Tanzania TV. 
    • Eros shares are down 1.6% to $8.18.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • SFET

    Safe-T up 26% on order from Israeli beverage maker

    • Thinly traded nano cap Safe-T (SFET +25.5%) is up up on a 22x surge in volume in response to its announced software order from the largest beverage maker in Israel. The ordered system is an extension of the SDE and SDA integration solution that the beverage company currently uses.
    • Safe-T says the order includes licenses for "thousands" of users.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • AMRS

    Amyris inks nutritional product royalty deal with China's Xinfu; shares up 2%

    • Amyris (AMRS +2.3%) is up on average volume in early trade on the heels of its announcement of a long-term contract with Xinfu of China for a "significant initial payment and a long-term minimum annual share" of an existing nutritional product royalty agreement.
    • The transaction enables Amyris to monetize a portion of the royalty stream to better manage volatility while maintaining access to future upside in the payment structure.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 48 Comments
  • SCHYY

    Sands China denies mobile ban in Mainland China

    • Sands China (OTCPK:SCHYY, OTCPK:SCHYF, LVS) responds to local reports that its mobile app is being banned in Mainland China.
    • "Sands China confirms that all our official mobile apps continue to be accessible and function normally from within China. Our applications and websites comply strictly with Chinese rules and regulations," reads a company statement.
    • Sands China closed up 2.3% in Hong Kong today, while parent Las Vegas Sands is up 1.1% in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 3 Comments
  • CPST

    H.C. Wainwright sees big upside for Capstone

    • There are "several catalysts in the story that support a healthy outlook for the company," H.C. Wainwright's Amit Dayal wrote in a research note, maintainng a Buy rating on Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST) shares, with a price target of $2.
    • Those include the company's Distributor Support System with $1.1M in funding, demand for lower cost remanufactured systems and its expansion in emerging markets.
    • CPST +5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 5 Comments
  • ACST

    Acasti up 4% premarket on advancement of CaPre studies

    • Nano cap Acasti Pharma (NASDAQ:ACST) is up 4% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement that patient randomization in its two Phase 3 clinical trials evaluating CaPre (omega-3 phospholipid) in patients with elevated triglycerides in the blood (hypertriglyceridemia) is now over 65% with more than 100 participants completing the six-month treatment plan.
    • On another note, it has received a notice from Nasdaq that its stock price no longer meets its $1 minimum bid price listing requirement so investors should expect a reverse stock split in the near future.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM

    APHA and TRXC among premarket losers

    • Cool Holdings (NASDAQ:AWSM) -7%.

  • SESN

    SFET, SESN among premarket gainers

    • Safe-T (NASDAQ:SFET) +47% on receiving an order from the largest Israeli beverage company.
    • Sesen Bio (NASDAQ:SESN) +9%.
    • Canada Goose Holdings (NYSE:GOOS) +8% after Beijing store dazzles.
    • Adamis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADMP) +8% files U.S. marketing application for fast-dissolving sublingual tadalafil tablet for ED.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • LPCN

    Lipocine up 6% premarket on Tlando phlebotomy study

    • Thinly traded nano cap Lipocine (NASDAQ:LPCN) is up 6% premarket, albeit on only 200 shares, in response to the results from a phlebotomy study assessing the potential ex vivo conversion of testosterone undecanoate (TLANDO) to testosterone in serum blood collection tubes.
    • The results showed no significant conversion in samples collected per the Phase 3 protocol.
    • The company conducted the study as part of its response to the FDA's CRL issued in May.
    • Previously: FDA rejects Lipocine's application for TRT med Tlando; shares down 38% premarket (May 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Bird Box lift for Netflix

    • Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is up 1.85% in premarket trading after Friday's late afternoon tweet on huge streaming numbers for Bird Box.
    • While the company is taking on some criticism for its limited approach to releasing viewership data and historical discrepancies with Nielsen numbers, there is no question that Bird Box is a trending topic on various social media platforms.
    • Some digging by The Verge indicates that at least 45M people watched at least 70% of the supernatural thriller. That number could be significantly higher considering friends and family may have watched the show together. The Hollywood Reporter's Daniel Feinberg isn't quite so positive. "I’m fairly sure Bird Box is a phenomenon of some sort, but without verifiable data or comparative data for context, a Netflix-affiliated Twitter feed coming down from on-high with suspiciously specific (and yet entirely vague) data is the epitome of nonsense," he tweeted.
    • Shares of Netflix are up 33% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM | 37 Comments
  • AMRN

    Amarin up 2% premarket

    • Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) is up 2% premarket on light volume, giving longs some hope that the recent selloff has run its course. Shares have retreated 43% since touching $23.34 on November 6.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 27 Comments

    TransEnterix down 9% premarket on $75M stock sales deal

    • TransEnterix (NYSEMKT:TRXC) is off 9% premarket on light volume on the heels of its $75M at-the-market stock sales agreement with Stifel.
    • Stifel will earn a 3% commission for its efforts.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 8 Comments
  • SPOT

    MKM: Spotify's valuation could triple; SPOT +1.6%

    • MKM Partners suggests Spotify's (NYSE:SPOT) market value could triple by 2022 with the stock trading at an attractive valuation following the recent pullback.
    • The firm has Spotify at a Buy rating and $200 target.
    • Source: Briefing.com.
    • Spotify shares are up 1.6% premarket to $114.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 5 Comments
  • PCG

    Height Capital Markets defends PG&E

    • Height Capital Markets updates on the developments with Pacific Gas & Electric (NYSE:PCG) and the California wildfires charges.
    • The firm thinks California Attorney General Xavier Becerra took a milder stance than some of the media headlines on potential murder charges are indicating this morning.
    • Height's take on the California AG: "He emphasized that his office offered no opinion regarding PCG’s criminal negligence or recklessness - only a summary of the charges they would face if found criminally culpable. With the AG’s brief out of the way, we are looking towards 2019 for the release of the much-anticipated Tubbs fire report from CalFire."
    • Last week, Citi defended PG&E by noting that structural changes forced on the company could lower future risk.
    • Previously: PG&E may face charges in California wildfires (Dec. 31)
    • PCG -4.35% premarket to $22.85.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM | 2 Comments
  • IIVI

    Northland steps to Outperform on II-VI

    • Brokerage service Northland Securities upgrades II-VI (NASDAQ:IIVI) from Market Perform to Outperform and raises the target by a dollar to $40, a 26% upside.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • In November, II-VI announced plans to acquire Finisar at a 38% premium for a total deal value of $3.2B.
    • IIVI shares are up 3% premarket to $32.76.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • CWH

    Camping World -4% after key exec departs

    • Shares of Camping World (NYSE:CWH) break lower in early action after the company discloses that Roger Nuttall resigned from his position as president.
    • No reason for Nuttall's departure was cited in the filing by Camping World.
    • SEC Form 8-K
    • CWH -4.43% premarket to $11.85 vs. a 52-week trading range of $11.01 to $46.46.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 23 Comments
  • APHA

    Aphria down 7% premarket on questions with Green Growth bid

    • Aphria (NYSE:APHA) slips 7% premarket on modest volume on the heels of a Bloomberg interview with Green Growth Brands CEO Peter Horvath about certain aspects of its all-stock $2.1B bid for the pot producer, a deal that short seller Hindenburg Research calls "non-credible."
    • Green Growth's second-largest shareholder is GA Opportunities Corp., a fund backed by Aphria and advised by CEO Vic Neufeld. Mr. Horvath says "normally we don’t ask who’s behind the money because normally the answer is very complicated."
    • Green Growth's largest shareholder, the Schottenstein family, was involved with Aphria about a year ago. Mr. Horvath says he is unaware if they own any Aphria stock.
    • Green Growth currently owns one retail store and has an option to buy another in Nevada. Mr. Horvath says his firm will have 300 mall kiosks by the "end of the year" (2019?).
    • Previously: Aphria says Green Growth's proposal undervalues its shares (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM | 38 Comments
  • TLRY

    Pot stocks poised to add to Friday's up moves

    • Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY), Cronos Group (NASDAQ:CRON) and Canopy Growth (NYSE:CGC) are up 2%, 3% and 2%, respectively, premarket, all on light volume.

  • Canada Goose +6% after Beijing store dazzles

    • Canada Goose's first store in China outside of Hong Kong is drawing huge crowds since opening on Friday, according to local reports.

  • PCG

    PG&E may face charges in California wildfires

    • California’s attorney general has told a federal judge it's possible that Pacific Gas & Electric (NYSE:PCG) could face charges up to murder if investigators find reckless operation of power equipment caused any deadly wildfires in the past two years.
    • The state’s largest power utility has until today to file its response.
    • According to the Sacramento Bee, the brief is purely advisory, and any criminal charges would most likely be filed by county district attorneys, not the state.
